topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1 GA: Release Notes
topic.shortdesc: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is a high-performance, high-availability, cloud operating system that enables telecommunications operators to use Commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) hardware to manage Virtualized Network Functions (VNF) within a carrier grade Network Function Virtualization (NFV) architecture.

body.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade brings together the flexibility and scalability of the IT cloud, and the high-availability and performance demanded by the Telecommunications industry, into a unique carrier grade, industry-leading solution to deliver a price-performance ratio well above alternative solutions. HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is aligned with the ETSI-NFV architecture

For more information on using HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Installation Guide and the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Administration Guide. For information on using the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Developer API, including API definitions and usage descriptions, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade SDK.

section.title: Supported Hardware Configuration
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade has been verified to work using the following hardware configuration:

li.p: The required number of controller nodes is two.
The required number of storage nodes is two. Storage nodes are optional, depending on storage needs.
The verified number of compute nodes is 20.
For predictable performance, it is recommended to disable hyper-threading in the BIOS of all nodes in the cluster.

section.title: Supported System Configuration
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade has been verified to work using the following system configuration:

li.p: 20 compute nodes with dual Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2670 v2 and E5-2640v3
up to four physical ports per compute node
maximum eight AVP vNICs per guest
maximum eight SR-IOV vNICs per guest
